intro: Phormium tenax var. variegatum, commonly known as the New Zealand flax or variegated flax, is a striking ornamental plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, sword-shaped leaves that exhibit a distinctive variegation pattern of green, white, and yellow. The plant is a member of the Asphodelaceae family and is known for its hardy nature, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are used in traditional Māori weaving and are also popular in gardens for their ornamental value. The plant produces tall, spiky flower stalks that bloom in spring, adding visual interest to the landscape.
